Description: The Department of Justice and the Department of the Interior announced that Freeport-McMoRan Corporation and Freeport-McMoRan Morenci Inc. agreed to pay $6.8 million to settle federal and state natural resource damages claims related to the Morenci copper mine in southeastern Arizona.
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/freeport-mcmoran-corp-and-freeport-mcmoran-morenci-inc-will-pay-68-million-damages-injuries

Company: Freeport McMoran Copper and Gold, Inc.
Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
NAICS Translation: 212234: Copper Ore and Nickel Ore Mining
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/site-page/2007-civil-penalties

Description: During a BSEE inspection, inspectors discovered an open hole, created by missing grating in the wellbay around the riser stack. The open hole was not properly barricaded to protect personnel from entering the hazardous area.  October 18, 2011
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid/safety/cp-paid-2012.pdf

Description: The U.S. Department of Labor's Mine Safety and Health Administration announced today that the Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission has upheld two civil penalties issued to Freeport-McMoran Morenci Inc. in Greenlee County, Ariz., in the Sept. 1, 2008, death of a miner. Raymond Saldana, a 67-year-old contractor consultant, had been working on a belt replacement project at the surface copper mine's Number 6 bedding plant when he fell nearly 30 feet to his death through an opening on an elevated walkway. The 4-by-5-foot hole, created by the removal of two steel gratings, was marked off only by a 3.5-inch-wide yellow caution tape affixed to one side of the opening.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20120925144613/http://www.msha.gov/MEDIA/PRESS/2011/NR111103.asp

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid//cy2016-cp-paid.pdf

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid/safety/cp-paid-2009-webpage.pdf

Description: During a BSEE incident investigation, it was discovered that McMoran failed to move equipment containing hydrocarbons at least 35 feet from welding area. Another violation was the explosion and rupture of two oil tanks which resulted in spilled oil into the Gulf of Mexico.  May 21, 2010 (2 violations)
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid/safety/cp-paid-2014-revised-42115.pdf

Description: During a BSEE incident investigation, it was discovered that a tubing hanger pin ejected while attempting to separate well head from well bore causing an injury.  Oct. 27, 2011
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid/safety/cp-paid-2014-revised-42115.pdf

Description: During the course of a BSEE Investigation into an incident with injury, it was discovered that McMoRan failed to adhere to safety policies and perform all operations in a safe and workmanlike manner during riser pipe decommissioning operations. They did not having proper management and onsite supervision to address safety hazards and deficiencies that contributed to the cause of the incident.  March 30, 2013
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid/safety/cp-paid-2014-revised-42115.pdf

Description: A Crane accident occurred while removing pins from the boom. The boom section was not securely blocked to prevent the dropping of the boom and/or boom section. Further investigation into the incident revealed the angle at which the auxiliary cable was attached to the heel section was insufficient and the auxiliary winch could not lift the boom.
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/Inspection-and-Enforcement/Civil-Penalties-and-Appeals/2010-Civil/Criminal-Penalties

Description: A fire occurred while repair work was being conducted on the contact tower's pressurized inlet valve. The fire destroyed the line heaters flame arrestor and posed a serious threat to the three personnel working in the immediate area as well as the other 17 personnel onboard the platform.
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/Inspection-and-Enforcement/Civil-Penalties-and-Appeals/2010-Civil/Criminal-Penalties

Description: During the course of a BSEE inspection, the operator failed to maintain and correct several areas of handrails with severe corrosion identified in a previous inspection.  Aug. 30, 2011-Jan.30-2012
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid/reports/cp-paid-2013.pdf

Description: During the course of a BSEE inspection, the inspector discovered that the PSH/L for the Heater Treater (NBK-0450) was pinned at the NBK-0450 relay in bypass and was not flagged or monitored.  July 2, 2012
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid/reports/cp-paid-2013.pdf

Description: During a BSEE Inspection, an inspector discovered that the PSH on the Fired Component fuel gas was blocked Out-of-Service, and was not flagged and monitored by personnel.  May 22, 2012
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid/reports/cp-paid-2013.pdf

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/site-page/2008-civil-penalties

Description: An inspection was conducted because an oil sheen was spotted during flight. Violations connected to the spill were due to the sump pile not operating automatically; the LSH and sum pile pneumatic pump failed, and then the sump pile was used as a processing device.  October 24, 2013 (3 violations)
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Info Source: https://www.bsee.gov/sites/bsee.gov/files/summary-of-civil-penalties-paid/safety/cp-paid-2014-revised-42115.pdf
